ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Retirement bards
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm, maybe better to travel to a city and find a nice watery space with easy access to a place to brew. I was surprised to read that there is a brew barrel in
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm, maybe better to travel to a city and find a nice watery space with
easy access to a place to brew.

I was surprised to read that there is a brew barrel in City of Mist. Not
exactly the place I'd go to for my brewing needs, but there is water there.

At 02:29 PM 10/31/00 -0700, you wrote:
>Oh I carry my spit with me wherever I go for on the spot baking
>opportunities. Now I just need a portable still and I'll be all set. For
>the trollish customers I can even make up a little Blackened Tier'dal every
>time Gix wanders too near chasing some newbie. ;-)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, October 31, 2000 2:25 PM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com; 'eqbards@egroups.com'
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Change to bard song mechanics on Test!
>
>
>ROFL! Nice Kit.
>
>While you're at it, take up baking and brewing.
>
>"Please sit down and have some fish fillets, fish head soup, fish rolls,
>and wash it down with some fish wine."
>Windleaf sings off key and starts murmuring to himself, "How did that song
>go?"
>
>At 02:13 PM 10/31/00 -0700, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
> >Yeah me too. I see myself retired by that little lake in W Commons,
> >fishing, doing the occasional tailoring. "Manasong? Oh you mean
>Cassindra's
> >Chorus of Clarity. No, I keep forgetting the words in the middle so I
>don't
> >sing that one any more. Want some nice fresh fish? I have a tailored
> >backpack full here for a mere 100pp."
> >
> > Kitasi
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
> >Sent: Tuesday, October 31, 2000 2:10 PM
> >To: eqbards@egroups.com
> >Subject: RE: [eqbards] Change to bard song mechanics on Test!
> >
> >
> >I just started making fishing lures, so I'm always busy during downtime
> >now. My poor fingers never get a break. Good thing I never play all that
> >long anyway. I may end up just being a fishing bard. If this patch goes
> >through, that may be all I'd be happy doing with my bard.
> >
> >I wonder how Verant would want us to role-play our song just immediately
> >stopping. "Hmmm, that's not how the tune went. Was there a key change in
> >there?" :-P
> >
> >---Windleaf
> >
> >At 02:00 PM 10/31/00 -0700, you wrote:
> > >lol. I always hit forage when it comes up so I never thought about
>sitting
> > >somewhere for more than a couple of minutes without hitting a button. It
> > >would never happen anyhow, too many casters go away after blowing all
>their
> > >mana while soloing and med for 15+ minutes while doing something else.
> > >
> > > Kit
> > >
> > >-----Original Message-----
> > >From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
> > >Sent: Tuesday, October 31, 2000 1:53 PM
> > >To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > >Subject: RE: [eqbards] Change to bard song mechanics on Test!
> > >
> > >
> > >I agree with you Kit. It's bad.
> > >
> > >Us bards have to press buttons every 5 secs to change songs and now we'll
> > >have to continue to be chained to our desks during downtime.
> > >
> > >Auto-logoff would be really bad, btw. Have you ever been in a room that
>has
> > >a motion sensor light? If you sit at your desk and you're reading, you
>have
> > >to wave your hand in the air every 15 min or end up in the dark.
> > >
> > >Auto-logoff is the same thing. You may be sitting reading stuff on your
> > >screen, not necessarily pushing any buttons for 10 mins, but get booted
>off
> > >just because the server thinks you're inactive. You'd have to make sure
>you
> > >push a button every 10 mins or be booted. After you're booted, you'd lose
> > >all of your no-rent items as well as any illusions you had up. I don't
> > >think Verant would even implement such a bad thing. Uhh, maybe not. Don't
> > >post the auto-logoff thing on the web Kit. Please! :-)
> > >
> > >---Windleaf
> > >
> > >At 01:25 PM 10/31/00 -0700, you wrote:
> > > >So it's okay to go AFK for 30 minutes to meditate or chloroplast heal
>but
> > > >not to Hymn? So are all caster buffs going to end when the caster logs
> >off
> > > >so they can't park an enchanter nearby just to clarity and log him on
>and
> > > >off? Plain and simple this is stupid. It's another example of where
> > > >probably some bard was sitting AFK on the planes and now we all have to
> >be
> > > >nerfed because someone abused the situation. Heaven forbid they should
> > > >handle this by putting in an auto logoff when someone is inactive for
> >more
> > > >than 10 minutes like most games do.
> > > >
> > > > Kit
> > > >
> > > >-----Original Message-----
> > > >From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
> > > >Sent: Tuesday, October 31, 2000 1:22 PM
> > > >To: eqbards@egroups.com; 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> > > >Subject: RE: [eqbards] Change to bard song mechanics on Test!
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >Absor has asked everyone to switch to a different thread on this:
> > > >
> > > >http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum3/HTML/003015.html
> > > >
> > > >I'd have to agree with Lago on Verant's reasoning that this is to keep
>us
> > > >from going AFK indefinitely.
> > > >
> > > >---Windleaf
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >At 12:58 PM 10/31/00 -0700, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
> > > > >Of course this will make Aria and Clouding instant death songs in
>many
> > > > >situations. I'm hoping this is a bug and not a change or I will be
> >done,
> > > > >trade skill changes or not. Maybe I won't uncancel my account next
> >week
> > > > >after all, sigh.
> > > > >
> > > > > Kit
> > > > >
> > > > >I just came across this thread in whineplay, which I think all of you
> > > >should
> > > > >take a look at. Evidently there has been a change to the mechanics
>of
> > >bard
> > > > >song on Test:
> > > > >
> > > > >http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum2/HTML/027490.html
> > > > >
> > > > >It appears that this change is to keep us from indefinitely playing a
> > >song
> > > > >while AFK. The message received is evidently "Your song ends
> >abruptly",
> > > >and
> > > > >has a chance of occuring on every pulse. Once again, Verant seems to
>be
> > > > >putting the screws to us. We can't take a break at all from the
> >keyboard
> > > >if
> > > > >we want to keep two songs up, now I have to stay at the keyboard to
> >keep
> > > >one
> > > > >song up as well. I guess bards dont need bathroom breaks.
> > > > >
> > > > >All this will do is encourage more use of a macroed gamepad.
> > > > >
> > > > >Lago Bardoon of Bertoxx, 48th Composition, Defenders of Aleria
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> >lol@...
> > > > >with the subject submissions.
